item.title: Embedded System Software Engineer - User Interfaces (burlingame)
item.description:
VSS Monitoring, Inc. is the world leader in traffic capture and the leading innovator of Distributed Traffic Capture Systems and network taps. Founded in 2003 by network experts, VSS Monitoring has delivered systems to thousands of customers worldwide, helping them maximize their visibility and gain proactive network control while achieving millions of dollars in lower monitoring costs. VSS Monitoring combines high-level intelligence and distributed traffic capture, making its products the industryÂ’s most capable.

As a member of our engineering team you will help design, build, test and refine all user interfaces for our embedded-system networking products. Your forward-thinking design will catapult our user's experience to new heights of ease-of-use and functionality. You'll design both web interfaces as well as command-line interfaces, using a combination of C on an embedded Linux platform, as well as Javascript and HTML/CSS/DHTML/XML. You should be able to create mockups quickly and rapidly develop basic features quickly. Your code should be documented well and elegantly designed. On the design side, you'll work closely with the product team to design for usability, create realistic schedules, diagnose and fix bugs.

This is NOT a graphic design position (although graphic design skills are desirable).
This is NOT an HTML/web design position alone (although web development skills are required).
The ideal candidate should be a capable C programmer, as well as a capable web application developer.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for the overall look and feel of a sleek and easy-to-use graphical user interface for managing embedded networking products.
Responsible for the overall look and feel of an easy-to-use character-oriented (command-line) user interface.
Some embedded C development will be involved, with a greater involvement in web technologies (Javascript, HTML/CSS).
Developing, programming, testing, and maintaining the product user interfaces based on product requirements.
Creating new layouts as needed including designing and coding pages and incorporating text, graphics, multimedia, and other features.
Maintaining consistency and quality control of design.
Providing ongoing support and design/layout.
Developing, documenting and maintaining standards and structure.

Experience:
At least 3+ years of work experience in C, preferably in an embedded-system environment and/or Linux.
At least 2+ years of work experience in web application development.
A strong working knowledge of Javascript and HTML/CSS required. XML and other web technology experience desirable.
Excellent layout and ergonomic instincts.
Knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues & strategies.
Experience with PHP or other similar server-side scripting languages.
Strong debugging skills and the ability to optimize code.
Understanding of OOP and event-driven programming.

Skills:
Passion for creating an elegant, friendly and richly functional user interface.
C fluency, preferably with embedded-system experience.
CSS/HTML/DHTML/Javascript fluency.
Effective English communication skills, both verbal and written.
Rapid-prototyping skills.
Ability to work quickly with little direction and indirect supervision.
Commitment to well executed, high-quality work.

Education:
BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent.
